summary: "Infinite Jest" is a 1996 novel by American author David Foster Wallace. It's known for its unique structure, including many detailed footnotes and endnotes. The story isn't told in a straight line, which makes it different from most books. Despite this, it became a bestseller and was named one of the best novels in English published in the 20th century by Time magazine. Over a million copies have been sold worldwide.
title: Infinite Jest
